channel.title: Opinions
channel.description: The Washington Post Opinions section features opinion articles, newspaper editorials and letters to the editor on the issues of the day. Offerings include the Post Partisan blog by Washington Post opinion writers, as well as political cartoons and political cartoon animations by editorial cartoonists Tom Toles and Ann Telnaes.

item.title: Sen. Chris Coons: I met with William Barr privately. Here are the commitments he needs to make to be attorney general.
item.dc:creator: By Chris Coons
item.description: He must vow to defend the independence of the Mueller probe, or be prepared to resign.

item.title: Is this curtains for Steve King, or what?
item.dc:creator: By Tom Toles
item.description: What are we supposed to pay attention to, again?

item.title: Trump says he’s ‘never worked for Russia’
item.dc:creator: By Ann Telnaes
item.description: Maybe not, but he's probably been played by Putin.

item.title: Trump’s effort to rig the census takes a hit
item.dc:creator: By Paul Waldman
item.description: Every once in a while, lying has a cost.

item.title: What Kasich can do to help
item.dc:creator: By Jennifer Rubin
item.description: He can do more than run for president

item.title: Don’t subpoena Trump’s interpreter
item.dc:creator: Randall D. Eliason
item.description: Presidential interpreters must not be forced to testify.

item.title: We cannot afford more media malpractice
item.dc:creator: Katrina vanden Heuvel
item.description: Why it degrades our democracy and drowns out real debate.

item.title: 2020 will be a national security election
item.dc:creator: Hugh Hewitt
item.description: The choice: More of Trump and his policies and people, or back to Obama-era make-believe.

item.title: Is Kamala Harris running for president? Passages from her book make her intentions known.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Capehart
item.description: The impression is set on page 5 of her 281-page book.

item.title: Will Democrats ask William Barr the right questions?
item.dc:creator: Harry Litman
item.description: The focus of his confirmation hearing may shift from a fight about recusal to a fight about transparency.

item.title: How is everyone coping with the national emergency? No, not that one.
item.dc:creator: Charles Lane
item.description: America is in 31 states of emergency. Is this what the Founders had in mind?

item.title: Turns out Republicans don’t care about the dignity of a paycheck after all
item.dc:creator: Catherine Rampell
item.description: The shutdown has revealed how little Republicans care about the “dignity of work.”

item.title: Please help Donald Trump find work during the shutdown
item.dc:creator: Dana Milbank
item.description: By his Twitter feed, it seems that Trump himself is furloughed.

item.title: The FBI’s willingness to investigate Trump shows we still have the rule of law
item.dc:creator: Max Boot
item.description: That law enforcement can investigate a president shows that we aren't a banana republic — yet.

item.title: Why are Republicans suddenly outraged over Steve King’s racism?
item.dc:creator: Eugene Robinson
item.description: The clamor of GOP voices is more amusing than inspiring.

item.title: Republicans need to condemn Trump’s brazen bigotry
item.dc:creator: Michael Gerson
item.description: Criticisms of Steve King seem to signal that the party is not really as bigoted as it appears. Then there’s the president.

item.title: Trump’s losing Syria. Will he lose the whole region too?
item.dc:creator: Richard Cohen
item.description: Other countries look to the U.S. for guidance and to enforce the rules. The president has utterly failed in that regard.

item.title: Enes Kanter: Anyone who speaks out against Erdogan is a target. That includes me.
item.dc:creator: Enes Kanter
item.description: Turkey’s strongman wants me back in his country so he can silence me.

item.title: Bill de Blasio: Yes, Democrats can deliver on big, progressive ideas
item.dc:creator: Bill de Blasio
item.description: And they can do it in a way that wins over Middle America.

item.title: Don’t expect Trump to go quietly
item.dc:creator: Ted Koppel
item.description: It’s unlikely that Trump in defeat or disgrace will become a quieter, humbler, more restrained presence on social media.

item.title: Happy 18th birthday, Wikipedia. Let’s celebrate the Internet’s good grown-up.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Harrison
item.description: On Wikipedia, truth matters more than self-expression.

item.title: I was in Congress during Nixon’s impeachment proceedings. William Barr is wrong.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Holtzman
item.description: Why did Bill Barr redefine the meaning of obstruction?

item.title: Forget Donald Trump. Congress can make a deal to end the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Editorial Board
item.description: Make it a tough-minded, creative compromise. Then the ball will be in his court.

item.title: Pompeo said the U.S. will hold Khashoggi’s killers accountable. Is he serious about it?
item.dc:creator: Editorial Board
item.description: Mr. Pompeo said the right things in a Saudi Arabia visit; the Senate should follow up, however, to make those words have meaning.

item.title: New York City’s blocked Airbnb ordinance is a lesson on what not to do
item.dc:creator: Editorial Board
item.description: Localities threaten to supplement overzealous laws with overzealous enforcement regimes.

item.title: Trump is ignoring the law to keep the shutdown from causing him political pain
item.dc:creator: By Sam Berger
item.description: In past shutdowns, more of the government ceased operating.

item.title: Teachers, EMTs, firefighters and other American heroes deserve a tax break
item.dc:creator: David Wallis
item.description: Too many of the people who keep our country running have to survive on too little. Let's give them something back.

item.title: How will Trump wishcast the latest polling data?
item.dc:creator: Daniel W. Drezner
item.description: If the Trump White House squints really hard, it can rationalize the latest polling data.

item.title: The revolving door between reality TV and the Trump administration
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Cramer Brownell
item.description: Why Anthony Scaramucci's turn on "Celebrity Big Brother" shouldn't come as a surprise

item.title: Trump is ignoring the law to keep the shutdown from causing him political pain
item.dc:creator: Sam Berger
item.description: In past shutdowns, more of the government ceased operating.

item.title: The brittle foundation of Trump’s Middle East policy
item.dc:creator: Daniel W. Drezner
item.description: The Trump administration's dysfunction finally alienates the Middle East.

item.title: The left is pushing Democrats to embrace their greatest president. Why that’s a good thing.
item.dc:creator: Lawrence B. Glickman
item.description: Democrats should proudly trumpet the New Deal — and extend it.

item.title: Opportunity Zones: Can a tax break for rich people really help poor people?
item.dc:creator: Jared Bernstein
item.description: Progressives should keep our powder dry but give this idea a chance.

item.title: Teacher strikes can’t fix the core problems with our schools
item.dc:creator: Diana D'Amico
item.description: City schools are suffering from suburban actions.

item.title: How to ensure the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra stays a ‘major-league team’
item.dc:creator: Gregory Tucker
item.description: Reductions to the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra will not help it,

item.title: What Alexandria is doing to take the gun-violence crisis into our own hands
item.dc:creator: Kerry Donley
item.description: If the federal government won’t act, cities and states must.

item.title: Why Prince George’s County Schools are rethinking discipline policies
item.dc:creator: Monica E. Goldson
item.description: Instead of writing our kids off, we are focusing on connecting them with needed support.

item.title: It’s a federal government shutdown, but my local small business is hurting
item.dc:creator: LaJuanna Russell
item.description: My employees won’t get paid, and that hurts everyone.

item.title: Youth rehabilitation in D.C.: From controversy to progress
item.dc:creator: Marc Schindler
item.description: The District is becoming a national leader in youth justice.

item.title: Juan Guaidó: Maduro es un usurpador. Es hora de restablecer la democracia.
item.dc:creator: By Juan Guaidó
item.description: Nuestra hoja de ruta es clara: lograr el cese de la usurpación mediante la unidad nacional y la presión interna y externa, conformar un gobierno de transición y convocar a elecciones libres.

item.title: Medieval things still work fine!
item.dc:creator: By Alexandra Petri
item.description: The combination moat and drawbridge remains the No. 1 technology for keeping armored knights from penetrating your keep.

item.title: What Trump’s fast-food feast and Gillette’s woke razor blades have in common
item.dc:creator: By Sonny Bunch
item.description: Trump's fast-food feast and Gillette's newly 'woke' advertising campaign are flip sides of the same coin, messages designed to appeal to different tribes with similar tactics.

item.title: ‘Vice’ portrays Dick Cheney as America’s dad — and that’s why conservatives might love it
item.dc:creator: By By Sonny BunchSonny Bunch
item.description: 'Vice' is a supposedly damning portrait of a much-reviled conservative politician.

item.title: Keep the hedge-fund vultures away from Gannett
item.dc:creator: By Erik Wemple
item.description: The offer involves two companies known for paring staff.

item.title: President Trump is extremely accessible
item.dc:creator: By By Erik WempleErik Wemple
item.description: The number of his Q-and-A sessions is skyrocketing. But is he being transparent?

item.title: Boston’s first black woman prosecutor has yet to take office, but she’s already facing an ethics complaint
item.dc:creator: By Radley Balko
item.description: This is just harassment, and an attempt to thwart the agenda of a reform-minded district attorney.

item.title: China is erasing what makes us unique
item.dc:creator: By Joshua Wong and Jeffrey Ngo
item.description: Hong Kong will resist China one national anthem at a time.

item.title: Bashing Trump’s wall is not enough
item.dc:creator: By By Joshua Wong and Jeffrey NgoNathan Gardels
item.description: Liberals need to own national sentiment.

item.title: If Dominion Power really cares, it should listen to people in Union Hill, Va.
item.dc:creator: By Letters to the Editor
item.description: Regarding the Jan. 9 Metro article “Permit for Va. pipeline station is approved”: As a former dispute resolution specialist with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, I have mediated hundred...

item.dc:creator: By By Letters to the EditorLetters to the Editor
item.description: Regardless of whether the president declares a national emergency, if he calls for the use of U.S. troops domestically or if he raids the Defense Department appropriation to build his wall, he will be...

item.title: What the Arab world needs most is free expression
item.dc:creator: By Jamal Khashoggi
item.description: The Arab world needs a modern version of the old transnational media so citizens can be informed about global events.

item.title: Is Kamala Harris running for president? Passages from her book make her intentions known.

item.description: The impression is set on page 5 of her 281-page book.
